intro: Vincetoxicum tristiflorum, commonly known as the purple false bindweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive purple underside and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is part of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. Its stems are often hairy and can become woody with age. Vincetoxicum tristiflorum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
